publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2125 Mr Brian Monteith: Doors Open Day—That the Parliament welcomes the Doors Open Day initiative, part of Scottish Archaeology Month 2001, which gives people the opportunity to visit and explore for a day, free of charge, various buildings across Scotland such as castles, stately homes and law courts, many of which are not normally open to the public, and believes that the initiative gives people the opportunity to improve their understanding of their local architectural environment and the country’s rich built heritage.
S1M-2125 Doors Open Day (lodged on 23 August 2001) Mr Keith Harding*, Christine Grahame*

S1M-2125 Mr Brian Monteith: Doors Open Day—That the Parliament welcomes the Doors Open Day initiative, part of Scottish Archaeology Month 2001, which gives people the opportunity to visit and explore for a day, free of charge, various buildings across Scotland such as castles, stately homes and law courts, many of which are not normally open to the public, and believes that the initiative gives people the opportunity to improve their understanding of their local architectural environment and the country’s rich built heritage. Supported by: Mr Keith Harding, Christine Grahame
S1M-2125 Doors Open Day (lodged on 23 August 2001) Donald Gorrie*, Nora Radcliffe*
S1M-2125 Doors Open Day (lodged on 23 August 2001) Mary Scanlon*, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*

Supported by: Mr Keith Harding, Christine Grahame, Donald Gorrie, Nora Radcliffe, Mary Scanlon, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh
S1M-2125 Doors Open Day (lodged on 23 August 2001) Mr Kenneth Gibson*
S1M-2125 Doors Open Day (lodged on 23 August 2001) Karen Whitefield*
S1M-2125 Doors Open Day (lodged on 23 August 2001) Mr Jamie McGrigor*, Karen Gillon*

Supported by: Mr Keith Harding, Christine Grahame, Donald Gorrie, Nora Radcliffe, Mary Scanlon, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Karen Whitefield, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Karen Gillon

S1M-2125 Mr Brian Monteith: Doors Open Day-That the Parliament welcomes the Doors Open Day initiative, part of Scottish Archaeology Month 2001, which gives people the opportunity to visit and explore for a day, free of charge, various buildings across Scotland such as castles, stately homes and law courts, many of which are not normally open to the public, and believes that the initiative gives people the opportunity to improve their understanding of their local architectural environment and the country's rich built heritage. S1M-2125 Mr Brian Monteith: Doors Open Day-That the Parliament welcomes the Doors Open Day initiative, part of Scottish Archaeology Month 2001, which gives people the opportunity to visit and explore for a day, free of charge, various buildings across Scotland such as castles, stately homes and law courts, many of which are not normally open to the public, and believes that the initiative gives people the opportunity to improve their understanding of their local architectural environment and the country's rich built heritage.
